sentences.sentence: And when the moon shone in the sky, the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) flew to the Rose Tree, and set her chest( 胸膛 ) against a thorn( 刺 ).
All night long she sang, and the cold silver moon came down closer to listen.
The thorn( 刺 ) pierced( 穿透 ) deeper and deeper into her body, and her blood flowed( 流淌 ) into the tree’s veins( 叶脉 ).
She sang first of the birth of love in the heart of a boy and a girl.
And on the highest branch( 树枝 ) of the Rose Tree there grew a beautiful rose, petal( 花瓣 ) following petal( 花瓣 ), as song followed song.
It was pale at first, like the mist( 薄雾 ) that hangs over the river in the morning light.
Slowly the rose grew larger on the highest branch( 树枝 ) of the Rose Tree.
But the Rose Tree called to the Nightingale( 夜莺 ), and told her to press her chest( 胸膛 ) closer against the thorn( 刺 ).
“Press closer, little Nightingale( 夜莺 ),” said the Rose Tree, “or the sun will rise before the rose is finished.”
So the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) pressed closer against the thorn( 刺 ), and sang louder and louder.
She sang now of the birth of love in the heart of a man and a woman.
And the petals( 花瓣 ) of the rose began to turn light pink, like the face of a man when he kisses a woman on their wedding( 婚礼 ) day.
But the thorn( 刺 ) had not yet pierced( 刺破 ) the Nightingale( 夜莺 )’s heart, so the center of the rose stayed white.
And then the Rose Tree called to the Nightingale( 夜莺 ), and told her to press her chest( 胸膛 ) closer against the thorn( 刺 ).
“Press closer, little Nightingale( 夜莺 ),” said the Rose Tree, “or the sun will rise before the rose is finished.”
So the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) pressed closer against the thorn( 刺 ).
The thorn( 刺 ) touched her heart, and a terrible pain went through her body.
Bitter( 剧烈的 ), bitter( 剧烈的 ) was the pain, and her song became wilder and wilder.
She sang of the love that is made perfect by death, and of the kind of love which can never die.
And the wonderful rose became deep red.
It was deep red at the edge of its petals( 花瓣 ), and deep red like a ruby( 红宝石 ) at its heart.
But the Nightingale( 夜莺 )’s voice grew weaker, and her eyes grew dimmer( 更加模糊的 ).
Her song grew more and more quiet, and she felt like there was something stuck in her throat( 喉咙 ).
Then she gave one last burst( 迸发 ) of music.
The white moon heard it and, forgetting that the sun was rising, stayed a little longer in the sky.
The red rose heard it, and it shook with pleasure, opening its petals( 花瓣 ) to the cold morning air.
“Look, look!” said the Tree, “the rose is finished now.”
But the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) did not answer, because she was lying dead in the long grass, with the thorn( 刺 ) in her heart.
And at noon the Student opened his window and looked out.
“How wonderfully lucky I am!” he said excitedly.
“Here is a red rose! I have never seen any rose like it in all my life. It is so beautiful!”
He bent down( 弯腰 ) and took it from the tree.
Then he put on his hat, and ran up to the Professor( 教授 )’s house with the rose in his hand.
The daughter of the Professor( 教授 ) was sitting by the door, and her little dog was lying at her feet.
“You said that you would dance with me if I brought you a red rose,” said the Student.
“Here is the reddest rose in all the world.
You will wear it tonight next to your heart, and as we dance together it will tell you how I love you.”
But the girl frowned( 皱眉 ).
“I am afraid it will not go with my dress,” she answered,
“and, besides, the Mayor( 市长 )’s son has sent me some real jewels( 珠宝 ), and everybody knows that jewels( 珠宝 ) cost much more than flowers.”
“Well, then you are very ungrateful( 不领情的 ),” said the Student angrily,
and he threw the rose into the street, under the wheels of a passing carriage.
“Ungrateful( 不领情的 )!” said the girl.
“Well, then you are very rude( 粗鲁的 ).
Anyway, who are you? You are only a Student, and have no money, and no nice clothes.
In fact, even your shoes are not as nice as those of the Mayor( 市长 )’s son.”
And after saying this, she got up from her chair and went into the house.
“What a silly thing love is,” said the Student as he walked away.
“It is not half as useful as logic( 逻辑 ), because it does not prove( 证明 ) anything.
Love tells people about things that are not going to happen, and makes people believe things that are not true.
In fact, it is not at all practical, and these days it is important to be practical about everything.
I will forget about love, and think only about the things that are written down in books.”
And then he returned to his room, pulled out a large dusty( 布满灰尘的 ) book, and began to read.

question.cn: 当夜莺把胸膛抵入玫瑰刺时，在歌唱什么？
question.en: Of what did the Nightingale sing while pressing against the thorn?

options.en: The sorrow about the incoming death.

analysis: 文中提到，“She sang first of the birth of love in the heart of a boy and a girl … she sang now of the birth of love in the heart of a man and a woman … she sang of the love that is made perfect by death, and of the kind of love which can never die.”夜莺歌唱的都是关于爱情的东西，因此选A。

question.cn: 女孩为什么拒绝了红玫瑰？
question.en: Why did the girl refuse the red rose?

options.cn: 相比红玫瑰，她更喜欢真正的珠宝。
options.en: She preferred real jewels to the red rose.

options.cn: 她的爸爸不喜欢男学生。
options.en: Her father disliked the young student.

analysis: 文中提到，“ 'I am afraid it will not go with my dress,' she answered, 'and, besides, the Mayor’s son had sent me some real jewels, and everybody knows that jewels cost much more than flowers.' ”因此，女孩没有接受男学生的玫瑰因为她得到了更贵重的珠宝，因此选A。

question.cn: 男学生被女孩拒绝之后，做了什么？
question.en: What did the boy do after he was refused by the girl?

analysis: 文中提到，“’I will forget about love, and think only about the things that are written down in books.’and then he returned to his room, pulled out a large dusty book, and began to read”,男学生被女孩拒绝之后，很难过，不再相信爱情，转头沉迷于书本中，因此选B。
